meanings.definition: Having a cutting edge or sharp point
meanings.sent1: The knife had an edged blade for slicing.
meanings.sent2: The scissors with the edged tips were perfect for cutting paper.
meanings.sent3: The edged sword gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like an edged weapon, cutting through his defenses.
meanings.sent5: The edged tool was so sharp that it could easily slice through the toughest materials.

meanings.sent1: The painting had an edged frame that added to its beauty.
meanings.sent2: The edged border of the garden was lined with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The edged design on the dress made it look elegant and stylish.
meanings.sent4: The edged outline of the map highlighted the country's boundaries.
meanings.sent5: The edged pattern on the fabric gave it a unique and decorative touch.

meanings.sent1: She edged closer to the edge of the cliff to get a better view.
meanings.sent2: The cat edged its way along the narrow ledge of the wall.
meanings.sent3: He edged his chair slowly towards the table to reach the book.
meanings.sent4: The car edged forward in the heavy traffic, inching its way through.
meanings.sent5: The hiker edged along the steep trail, careful not to slip on the rocks.

meanings.definition: To provide with an edge or border
meanings.sent1: She edged the photo with a decorative border before framing it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor edged the dress with lace for a delicate finish.
meanings.sent3: He edged the garden path with colorful stones for a neat look.
meanings.sent4: The chef edged the dessert plate with chocolate sauce for a fancy presentation.
meanings.sent5: The artist edged the painting with gold leaf to give it a luxurious touch.
